a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (00:17): eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee : there has been no follow-up to e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0's summary e-mail
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (00:17): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 should no longer be muted
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (00:17): (that is, no further emails since the charter discussion)

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (00:18): ... his recommendation is that if nothing has happened by July 2008, then we just revert to the HTML WG owns forms in HTML and the Forms WG owns forms as a standalone
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (00:18): This seems reasonable to all on the call
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (00:18): eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee : So I think his recommended course of action is good.
dbc2e1863f76e59b4c85c338c0eff407 (00:19): ACTION-52 Bring summary of where the Forms TF is and recommendation for action to HTML WG closed
dbc2e1863f76e59b4c85c338c0eff407 (00:19): ACTION-53 -- Dan Connolly to check for offline api stuff in WebAPI proposed charter -- due 2008-02-28 -- PENDINGREVIEW
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:19): FWIW, Ian Hickson would like explicit consent from the Forms WG that they're ok with us working on forms again, as I understand it.
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (00:19): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 should no longer be muted
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:19): i just want to make sure that i don't start integrating wf2 into html5 only later to be told that it needs to all be undone and turned into xforms
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:20): if the group decides that wf2 is fine and we're not going to try to use xforms, that works too
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (00:20): action: Chris Wilson to follow up with Forms WG to make sure they understand this plan of action by 5/1/2008
dbc2e1863f76e59b4c85c338c0eff407 (00:20): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
dbc2e1863f76e59b4c85c338c0eff407 (00:20): Created ACTION-56 - Wilson to follow up with Forms WG to make sure they understand this plan of action by 5/1/2008 [on Chris Wilson - due 2008-04-03].
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (00:21): noted.  I'll make sure that we follow up with them.
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (00:22): we are trying to work together here, but we do want to eventually ship html5.  With forms.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:23): certainly, since they are forms experts, their input can only make the spec better
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:23): it is unfortunate that they have not been forthcoming with feedback so far
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (00:23): Mike: not going to have mention of offline apps in webapi charter
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (00:25): I want this ot be discussed in the hypertext cg, so I'm keeping the action pending review.

dbc2e1863f76e59b4c85c338c0eff407 (00:25): ACTION-54 -- Gregory Rosmaita to work with SteveF draft text for HTML 5 spec to require producers/authors to include @alt on img elements -- due 2008-04-02 -- PENDINGREVIEW
